flowRoot.flowPara: 1/8" (0.125") seam allowance on all seams. Top piping may require slightly more or less depending on how you attach it. My method may not have been the best, and it's difficult to describe. Basically:
1. Sew the two piping pieces together a little under an inch along the short edge, grain sides facing in.
2. Open the piping up and lay it as flat as you can

3. Sew the piping beginning at this seam you created above, by matching it with the seam running up the side of the bag, and sewing out from that seam on both sides (two saddle stitches going at the same time)

4. An inch or two betore the two sets of stitches meet again at the seam on the opposite end of the bag, measure the remaining distance in the seam, mark it on the piping and sew it together as you did at the beginning, cutting off the excess and folding it flat, so that when you finish the piping will fit the top of the bag well.
